channel.title: MacInTouch
channel.description: The original Mac news and information site since 1994

item.title: Amazon Update
item.description: Save $100 at Amazon on the 13" MacBooks. Save $150 off the latest MacBook Pro and $250 off 1.83GHz and 2.0GHz MacBook *Pro* models. Or get $100 off a fast, quiet iMac Core Duo system. iPods, Apple, Adobe and Microsoft software are all on sale, too. (While you're saving money, you're also providing critical MacInTouch support by purchasing via our Amazon links!)

item.description: pricing, memory, keyboard, screen and finish, Final Cut Pro compatibility and more

item.description: broken sound fix

item.title: Apple: Xcode 2.3
item.description: The Xcode update adds support for the DWARF debugging format for enhanced debugging fidelity, plus more.

item.title: Apple: Logic Express 7.2.1
item.description: ReWire and ReCycle support for Intel Macs, direct playback of MP3 files, compatibility with Garageband 3 projects, and more.

item.title: New: Mercury Elite-AL 800 Pro RAID-1 Mirror
item.description: Other World Computing's new system is configured as a mirror RAID and available in capacities up to 2 x 750 GB.

item.title: New: Videator 1.0
item.description: Stone Design released Videator, a video processing application that can add effects to both live video and existing movies.

item.title: Update: QuarkXPress 7
item.description: The page layout software adds advanced OpenType support, a glyph palette, a measurement palette, shared content enhancements, shared layouts, job jackets, and much more.

item.title: Update: SubEthaEdit 2.5
item.description: The collaborative text editor adds broad AppleScript support, including an application-wide AppleScript menu, exposure of modes as AppleScript objects, and extension of modes via AppleScript.

item.title: Update: Yummy FTP 1.5
item.description: The FTP/SFTP client is a Universal Binary and adds SSL/TLS support, DualBrowse (navigation of local and server lists in sync), synchronization previews, and other changes.

item.title: Update: TextExpander 1.3
item.description: The auto-typing and snippet utility adds the ability to refer to other snippets as variables, creation of snippets directly from selected text by means of the TextExpander Service, and other changes.

item.title: Update: Barcode Producer 3.8
item.description: The barcode generator adds optimized vector EPS output for QuarkXPress 7, revised integration information for QuarkXPress 7, integrated vector output with no non-standard fonts, and other enhancements.

item.title: Notes and Tips: MacBook Memory Comparison
item.description: How critical is it to pair matched memory cards in the new MacBook? Our Cinebench test results may provide a clue.

item.title: Special Report: Mac Performance Comparison
item.description: We've added iBook G4 and MacBook results for Xbench, Cinebench, Geekbench, MPEG-4 conversion and file duplication....

item.title: Notes and Tips: iWeb vs. .Mac
item.description: iWeb 1.1: Errors when attempting to "Publish All to .Mac"

item.title: Notes and Tips: Adobe vs. Apple Updates
item.description: "After the most-recent security and QuickTime updates, the latest Intel machines choke on Adobe installations."

item.title: Notes and Tips: Parallels Overload
item.description: "Those of us purchasing keys for Parallels Workstation should be aware (according to Benjamin H. Rudolph, Marketing guy @ Parallels) that their support team is a little overworked right now."

item.title: Other News: Chip-Level Attacks?
item.description: "A chip-level attack targets a feature or vulnerability in the processor rather than attacking software as is the case with nearly all today's security threats."

item.title: Other News: Rejected PowerPC Option
item.description: "When word leaked out that Apple had signed on with Intel, it shocked the PA Semi staff, according to multiple sources."

item.title: Other News: Woz Interview
item.description: "BusinessWeek associate editor Hardy Green interviewed Wozniak on May 20 at the book industry's annual extravaganza, BookExpo America, in Washington, D.C."

item.title: Other News: Sony Settles Trojan Suit
item.description: "According to terms of the deal, Sony BMG will let consumers who bought the CDs receive replacement discs without the anti-piracy technologies and will let them choose one of two incentive packages that provide cash or free music downloads."

item.title: Other News: Microsoft Virtualization
item.description: "Virtualization, which today generally refers to the ability to run multiple operating systems simultaneously to make a computer more efficient, is a hot area and one in which Microsoft lags rivals."

item.title: Server Load
item.description: Our web server and network are seeing high demand peaks during the weekday "rush" period (typically 10:30-12:30 EDT) and during special Apple events (or while being "slashdotted"), causing occasional slowdowns in page delivery. Visiting outside these rush times will provide the fastest server response.
